task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 25°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the main building (base and roofline), so I should tilt up to capture the top while keeping the building centered.
The target building is supposed to be around 25° to the right of north, so I should yaw right to re-center it in view while keeping the upward pitch to judge roof height.
With the building re-centered, I should look up to capture the roofline and upper floors to estimate total height from ground to top.
The view is back to due north again, so I need to rotate right about 25° to align with the north-east building while keeping the upward tilt for height estimation.
To estimate height I need a clear view from base to roof, so I will tilt down to include the ground-level base of the building for a full vertical span reference.
I’m again facing due north; I should rotate right ~25° to bring the NE building back into view while staying pitched down to see its base.
I now need both the building base and roof in one view; stepping closer may help reduce obstruction and make floors countable.
After moving, my heading shifted to east, so I should rotate left about 68° to re-face the target building at ~25° NE for height estimation.
I overshot to the west; rotating right to about 22° should align me back toward the NE building (~25°) to evaluate its full height.
From due east, the target is around 25° (NE), so I should rotate left about 65° to face it directly.
The building should be at heading ~25°, and a right rotation of 90° will put me exactly on that heading for a clear height estimate.
Rotations have been inconsistent; the quickest is to rotate left to due north (0°) then later fine-tune to 25° NE, so start by turning left 90°.
From 270° (west), rotating right to 0° (north) will reorient me, then I can adjust to 25° NE for the building view.
I need to directly face ~25° NE; from 90° E, rotating left 65° will bring the heading to about 25°.
The interface shows that looking right sets heading to 25°, which matches the NE target direction, so rotate right 90° to lock onto it.
Since rotations are not landing on 25° as expected, I will stop rotating and instead move forward to get closer, then re-assess building height from a nearer vantage.
